data.title: Great Food and a great atmosphere
data.text: I've been visiting this place on and off for the past 4 years. The food is fantastic, it's authentic, and it really hits the spot! The portion sizes could be a little bigger, but overall it's a pretty decent price for the portion size. I normally buy the family size platters just so that I can have some to take back to the hotel with me so that I could eat more later. If you're going to be in Boise this is definitely a place to stop and eat. Overall I give it an 8 out of 10.

data.title: Best in the West
data.text: This was the best Chinese restaurant in the Western United States, period! The family retired too bad!

data.title: Nice meal, nice service, soon closing
data.text: We learned while we were here for the first time that it might be the last time as well. This place is closing in the second half of March 2016. We had a nice meal. The service is not the fastest, and that can be a welcoming change. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. She seemed to know well what customers want. Food was OK, not great. We did like the hint of spiciness after we asked for very hot food.

data.title: Enjoyed the Meal
data.text: In a trip to Boise, I stayed next door to the Twin Dragon Chinese restaurant at the Red Lion. After a long day of travel, I felt like Chinese would be a reasonable choice. This restaurant was so convenient that I thought it would be worth the try. While it was close to empty of people, the hostess greeted me politely and the waitress was nice and friendly. The food was tastier and better prepared than average. Certainly not at a superior level, but worth the stop and the meal.

data.title: Twin Dragon review
data.text: This is a pretty standard fare Chinese restaurant. We was disappointed in the food - the Pork Fried Rice the texture and taste bof yesterday's re-heated. The Seafood Soup was good, but lacked some seafood. It was spicy hot. The rest of the meal, we had Family Dinner #5, was OK, but not much more.

data.title: Considering the location....
data.text:
As other reviewers have noted, this is the type of restaurant that existed before the fast food ones like Panda Express or the teriyaki shops came on the scene.  It is also the type of restaurant you would find where the Chinese population is small.  Considering the location, it is actually pretty good.  We went back the next day.  

This restaurant is one of the few Asian restaurants I've been in lately where the service was good.  Maybe it is because the wait staff is not Asian.  The cook is, though, and the cuisine leans towards Cantonese.  We had vegetarian clay pot and beef chow mein with HK style pan fried noodles.  We were not disappointed.  The next day we had seafood soup, General chicken (meaning it is some general's chicken, but not General Tso - the chicken was crispy on the outside) and seafood chow mein with HK style pan fried noodles (yes, we like pan fried noodles).  These were all good choices and we left feeling full and satisfied, but not weighted down with heavy food.  We also didn't feel like it broke the bank.

data.title: Classic Chinese
data.text:
Solid food and good size portions. Egg Foo Young is great. Fried Rice there is my favorite. Shrimp is good and with excellent breading. Yes breading and its fried. Old School Chinese food! Service is always nice and friendly. The host, if asked might even sing for you - beautiful voice! 
         No folks this isn't exotic Chinese. But the cooks are for real and as I said the food is in the old style Chinese food that I remember. With neon dragon sign! The kind before, all you can eat buffets and chain restaurants. They are open later than most as well. It is close to downtown and everything it has to offer as well.

data.title: Yummmm
data.text: Sweet sour soup !  House fried rice is delicious and plentiful for one !  Very well proportional for its price !

data.title: Classic old school Chinese
data.text:
Like the sort of place you see in movies & TV from the 1950's
Old world classic American Chinese
Nothing special, yet still nothing wrong in Boise....

data.title: VERY GOOD !
data.text: This is a very good place to eat. Service is excellent with great servers. Seating is plentiful and is really clean. Food is tasty and portions are almost too much. I'm not a local but will eat here again when back in town.

data.title: Classic old school chinese
data.text:
A very standard old school Chinese American restaurant offering delicious affordable classics in a no nonsense way.
A good choice.

data.title: Classic Boise Chinese
data.text: Quite good, classic Chinese food.  Pork Fried Rice, Pork Chow Mein, and Mandarin Chicken, all a bit greasy and all exactly as I would expect them to be for a Idaho Chinese experience.  Good meal and a good value.  Been here dozens of times over the years and will keep going back.

data.title: Excellent Noodles Surpass Ambiance
data.text: The spicy beef noodles were the perfect medicine on a cold, damp day. My wife's Singapore noodles were also a taste of paradise. Excellent, friendly, helpful service. It may be an older location, but authentic food beats trendy ambiance every time. Twin Dragon may have a rather tired dining room, but the food is fresh, fast, and delicious.

data.title: Good food and good value
data.text: Ate an evening meal at the Twin Dragon. It was very good. Shrimp with lobster sauce. Good sized portion, shrimp were very tasty and fresh. Egg roll was crispy on the outside and warm and tasty inside and was a big serving. Wait staff very friendly and helpful. As with all Chinese food it was their own version. Have no hesitation recommending this establishment.

data.title: The best of Chinese Americana style cuisine
data.text: Kitschy, old American Chinese favorites with diner style servers. This place is the kind delicious, hit the spot Chinese food that you secretly crave. Let your fair weather friends go to the hipster fusion places and do yourself a favor and take your best friends here. Sizzling clay pot, wor won-ton soup and mandarin chicken are all delicious.

data.title: I'm impressed
data.text: Neighbor has touted his likeness for this place for years.. I'd never been.. A friend and I went today in the middle of an uncommon downtown Boise snowstorm.. We were nearly the only ones in the place.. Delightful waitress.. Easy to read lunch menu...Generous portion of good quality shrimp and  lots of pea pods..Soft chow mein noodles were thin and good.. mixed with thin crunchy noodles.. When you brought up a fork full.. you got a little of everything.. No soup.. but a good quantity for $7.

data.title: An old favorite not so favorite anymore
data.text: We've been going to Twin Dragon for literally generations in my family. With changes over time, it's gone from pretty good to about average with many of the dishes too salty and oily. The pork and seed is still good, with fresh pork loin. Overall, I may return from sentiment--but maybe not.

data.title: Pretty good food, great service
data.text:
Pros: Open very late, very nice servers and hostess, average chinese food, clean

Cons: atmosphere, dated interior, slightly overpriced

data.title: Fast and friendly service, great food.
data.text: Not sure what the two lower star reviewers were thinking but this place was very good and we walked to it from our hotel(red lion).  The waitress we had was very funny and very nice, the food was good.  The best Chinese food I have ever had was in Willard Ohio but this place was very good as well. I ordered the spicy pork and it was delicious. Not spicy enough for me, so the waitress brought me some chili paste! Yum.

data.title: Been going here for more than 30 years and always will
data.text:
Wow some of the reviews are way off.
I have been going here since i was ten years old.
this place rocks, quality American Chinese with some wonderful and awesome dry humored, old school staff and awesome hot mustard.it is the only food i have ever had dreams about:).( Long story) try the shrimp toast or Mandarin chicken.or Cantonese beef steak i will put it up against any, American style Chinese restaurant and it will win hands down. I live here and i would recommend it to anyone  after 1 pm there is no place like it..
